info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 4:35PM CDT until August 30 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Fort Bend and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 435 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pasadena, northeastern Sugar Land, western Missouri City, Stafford, South Houston, Bellaire, West University Place, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Hunters Creek Village, Bunker Hill Village, Piney Point Village, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, University Place, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Astrodome Area, Neartown / Montrose, Memorial Park, Midtown Houston and Fourth Ward. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING
